attributes.action: Ban the sale of expirable gift vouchers in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Expirable vouchers provide no benefit to the consumer, when the voucher expires the company profits at minimal cost to themselves and at a great inconvinience to the consumer.

There is no need for gift cards / vouchers to expire and the value they represent should remain the same as they were purchased until they are used.  If they remain unused that gift card/voucher should be considered a liability by the company to the consumer.
attributes.background:
Ban the sale of gift card/vouchers with expirys, inparticular gift cards that hold a currency value and experience vouchers.

The gift card/voucher should represent a liability owed by the company to the consumer until that gift card/voucher is used.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. 

Decisions relating to the validity of gift cards and vouchers are a matter for individual retailers.
